Speaker: Mr SPEAKER
Title: Unknown
text: Rt. Hon. W. A. Watt) took the chair at 2.30 p.m., and read prayers. NA PROFITS. MOTION OF CENSUBE.

Speaker: Mr SCULLIN
Title: DISTRIBUTION OF WOOL
text: I give notice that tomorrow I shall move That this House strongly condemns the Government for its action, in(a) Agreeing to pay out of public revenue the sum of £276,393 10B. for distribution between the British Government and B.A.W.R.A. on a claim that had neither legal nor moral support; (b) Entering into the agreement without consulting Parliament; and (fi) Making a part payment of £137,696 15s. without Parliamentary appropriation.

Speaker: Mr CHARLTON
Title: DISTRIBUTION OF WOOL
text: Hunter) [2.82] - I desire to intimate to the Prime Minister (Mr Bruce) that the motion of which the honourable member for Yarra (Mr Scullin) has just given notice has the approval of the Labour party and myself. Ur. BRUCE (Flinders-Prime Minister and Minister for External Affairs) [2.33] - In view of the announcement of the Leader of the Opposition (Mr Charlton) that his party is supportingthe motion, which strongly condemns the Government for a certain action, Ministers have no option but to regard it as a direct motion of censure hy the Opposition, and, consequently, I shall pursue the usual course, and move That the House do now adjourn. Question resolved in the affirmative. House adjourned at 2.34 p.m.
